p: These warnings about growing levels of food insecurity in developing and developed countries came as the global outlook for food supplies remained largely stable and global food reserves were high. Due to good harvests in 2019 and in early 2020, stock-to-utilization ratios were considerably higher than during the 2007 and 2008 crisis (e.g., Headey and Fan, 2008; World Bank, 2020b). Primary agricultural production has not been severely affected by the crisis during 2020.
